Let us denote by $p_n\colon J^n_X(E)\to X$ the join of $n+1$ copies of a fibration $p\colon E\rightarrow X$. As it is well-known \cite{Schwarz66}, ${\rm secat}(p)\le n$ if and only if $p_n$ admits a homotopy section. By definition, ${\rm msecat}(p)$ is the smallest $n$ such that  ${ {A_{PL}}}(p_n)$ admits a homotopy retraction of ${ {A_{PL}}}(X)$-modules, where ${ {A_{PL}}}$ denotes Sullivan's functor of piecewise linear forms\cite{Su77}.\\

mathml: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex21.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="d=d_{0}+d_{+}\in P\otimes B\oplus P\otimes B\otimes s^{-m-p}Z^{\otimes m+p+1}" display="block"><mrow><mi>d</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><msub><mi>d</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>d</mi><mo>+</mo></msub></mrow><mo>∈</mo><mrow><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo>⊗</mo><mi>B</mi></mrow><mo>⊕</mo><mrow><mrow><mi>P</mi><mo>⊗</mo><mi>B</mi><mo>⊗</mo><msup><mi>s</mi><mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mi>m</mi></mrow><mo>-</mo><mi>p</mi></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><msup><mi>Z</mi><mrow><mi/><mo>⊗</mo><mrow><mi>m</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>p</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mrow></math>

nexttext:
admits a retraction $r$ of $(A\otimes B,d)$-modules. 
Finally the composite
prevtext:
we can check that
\begin{itemize}
\item $d_0\psi(s^{-p}y)=(-1)^ {|\omega|}\psi(d_0s^{-p}y)$ using the fact that $d_0\theta=\omega$, and
\item $d_+\psi(s^{-p}y)=(-1)^ {|\omega|}\psi(d_+s^{-p}y)$ using the fact
that $d_+\theta=0$. 





\end{itemize}

\noindent From ${\rm msecat}(f\times g)\leq m+p$ we know that the morphism
text: $$j_{m+p}^{A\otimes B}\colon A\otimes B \to A\otimes B \otimes ({\mathbb{Q}}\oplus s^{-m-p}Z^{\otimes m+p+1})$$
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.Ex22.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="j_{m+p}^{A\otimes B}\colon A\otimes B\to A\otimes B\otimes({\mathbb{Q}}\oplus s%
^{-m-p}Z^{\otimes m+p+1})" display="block"><mrow><msubsup><mi>j</mi><mrow><mi>m</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi><mo>⊗</mo><mi>B</mi></mrow></msubsup><mo>:</mo><mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi><mo>⊗</mo><mi>B</mi></mrow><mo>→</mo><mrow><mi>A</mi><mo>⊗</mo><mi>B</mi><mo>⊗</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><mi>ℚ</mi><mo>⊕</mo><mrow><msup><mi>s</mi><mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mi>m</mi></mrow><mo>-</mo><mi>p</mi></mrow></msup><mo>⁢</mo><msup><mi>Z</mi><mrow><mi/><mo>⊗</mo><mrow><mi>m</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>p</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mrow></math>

nexttext:
gives a morphism (of degree $0$) of $(B,d)$-module which is a retraction for the inclusion $B\to B\otimes ({\mathbb{Q}}\oplus s^ {-p}Y^ {\otimes p+1})$.
This proves that ${\rm msecat}(g)\leq p$.
\end{proof}
